page.title: 09Recreation, Warbleton
page.content: The many woods and fields provide wonderful walking facilities, with many footpaths clearly marked. In snow tobogganists enjoy the hilly places. Attractive lanes provide pleasant routes for cyclists and horse-riders. Many people spend their leisure time gardening. The Annual Flower Show is held on the Village Green. The Warbleton & Buxted Silver Band plays at the Show in July and is based in the Village. The Church has a lively choir who practice every week and a team of bellringers. Many people enjoy shooting and there is a flourishing cricket club and several private tennis courts, but most facilities are outside the area, and many people travel to Hailsham, Eastbourne and Bewl Bridge for squash, swimming and water sports, theatre, cinema and evening classes.
